issue.title: session_regenerate_id(): Session write failed.

repository.name: humhub
repository.description: HumHub is an Open Source Enterprise Social Network. Easy to install, intuitive to use and extendable with countless freely available modules.

issue.body:
I'm having this in the logs after last `master` git pull.
```
yii\base\ErrorException: session_regenerate_id(): Session write failed. ID: user (path: /tmp/humhub) in public/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/web/Session.php:283

Stack trace:

#0 [internal function]: yii\base\ErrorHandler->handleError(2, 'session_regener...', '/public...', 283, Array)
#1 public/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/web/Session.php(283): session_regenerate_id(false)
#2 public/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/web/DbSession.php(103): yii\web\Session->regenerateID(false)
#3 public/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/web/User.php(618): yii\web\DbSession->regenerateID(true)
#4 public/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/web/User.php(292): yii\web\User->switchIdentity(Object(humhub\modules\user\models\User), 2592000)
#5 public/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/web/User.php(674): yii\web\User->loginByCookie()
#6 public/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/web/User.php(188): yii\web\User->renewAuthStatus()
#7 public/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/web/User.php(333): yii\web\User->getIdentity()
#8 public/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/base/Component.php(132): yii\web\User->getIsGuest()
#9 public/protected/humhub/components/i18n/I18N.php(32): yii\base\Component->__get('isGuest')
#10 public/protected/humhub/components/bootstrap/LanguageSelector.php(28): humhub\components\i18n\I18N->autosetLocale()
#11 public/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/base/Application.php(320): humhub\components\bootstrap\LanguageSelector->bootstrap(Object(humhub\components\Application))
#12 public/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/web/Application.php(69): yii\base\Application->bootstrap()
#13 public/protected/humhub/components/Application.php(46): yii\web\Application->bootstrap()
#14 public/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/base/Application.php(272): humhub\components\Application->bootstrap()
#15 public/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/base/Object.php(107): yii\base\Application->init()
#16 public/protected/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/base/Application.php(205): yii\base\Object->__construct(Array)
#17 public/index.php(25): yii\base\Application->__construct(Array)
#18 {main} 
```

body:
Can and will it support things like MySQL's ``VALUES(`col`)``?

```mysql
INSERT INTO `table` (..., `col`)
VALUES (..., 1)
ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE `col` = `col` + VALUES(`col`);
```

Does it violate AR concept?
Without this feature stupid MySQL cause stupid problems. One of underlying reasons is that it cannot lock phantom rows. I did try two scenarios to perform `INSERT or UPDATE;` with non-AI PK and both does hit deadlock due to this reason. I want again to throw MySQL into trash can.

Something like this:

`INSERT INTO table (a,b,c) VALUES (1,2,3),(4,5,6)
    ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE c=VALUES(a)+VALUES(b);`

https://mariadb.com/kb/en/mariadb/values/

Sorry, I want to ask about referencing to old value:

```mysql
ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE `col` = `col` + ...
```
Without this ability the subject feature is not so cool. Without this I still need to combine SELECT with INSERT or UPDATE.

Usage of ``VALUES(`col`)`` for single row INSERT is not so necessary. Just copy insertable value literally.
Of course, expressions should be supported.

From the suggested signature: 

```php
public function upsert($table, $columns, &$params);
```

We will be doing basic queries like:
```php
$queryBuilder->upsert('item', [
    'id' => 1
    'name' => 'some item name',
    'description' => 'lorem ipsum blablabla'
    // other columns
]);
```

Which will provide something like:

```sql
INSERT INTO `item`
(`id`, `name`, `description`, /* other columns */)
VALUES
(...)
ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE
`id` = VALUES(`id`),
`name` = VALUES(`name`),
`description` = VALUES(`description`),
/* other columns */
```

It would also be good to have, like the `insert()` and `batchInsert()`, a function `batchUpsert()`. But then some problem might arise. For example where in some cases there are `null` values which should not override a previously filled column. How do we apply expression on the `UPDATE` part:

```sql
INSERT INTO `item`
(`id`, `name`, `description`, /* other columns */)
VALUES
(...),
(...),
(...),
(...),
(...)
ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE
`id` = VALUES(`id`),
`name` = COALESCE(VALUES(`name`), `name`),
`description` = COALESCE(VALUES(`description`), `description`),
/* other columns */
```

issue.title: Problem with unique rule on concurrent transaction

labels.name: status:to be verified
labels.description: Needs to be reproduced and validated.

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
### What steps will reproduce the problem?

* Create 2 concurrent action that try to insert a record with the same value. I use 2 instance of yii2 queue worker.
* Push 2 queue job that try to insert a record with the same value.
* The 2 worker will receive the job at nearly the same time, and insert the record concurrently

### What is the expected result?

* The first job get executed and inserted the row successfully
* The latter job failed the validation rule and return false on `validate()` or `save()`

### What do you get instead?

* The first job get executed and inserted the row successfully
* The latter job pass the validation rule, but get `Integrity constraint violation: 1062 Duplicate entry` error

### Additional info

What I think is happening:

job 1 | job 2
------------|-----------
unique rule check if record already exist | unique rule check if record already exist
record is not exist yet | record is not exist yet
try to insert new row | try to insert new row
row inserted successfully | row already exist, integrity constraint violation

| Q                | A
| ---------------- | ---
| Yii version      | 2.0.12
| PHP version      | 7.1.7-1 & 7.1.8-2
| Operating system | Ubuntu 16.04.2 LTS & Linux Mint 18.2

issue.title: Fix DbSession::writeSession race condition.

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | yes
| New feature?  | no
| Breaks BC?    | no
| Tests pass?   | yes
| Fixed issues  | #13212

It has been previously reported #13212 There is a race condition in `DbSession::writeSession()`. 

```
Integrity constraint violation: SQLSTATE[23000]: Integrity constraint violation: 1062 Duplicate entry 'kupbup8mepuaco3dr5qdretsde' for key 'PRIMARY'
The SQL being executed was: INSERT INTO `YiiSession` (`data`, `id`, `expire`) VALUES ('__flash|a:0:{}', 'kupbup8mepuaco3dr5qdretsde', 1510386856)
```

After updating to `2.0.13`, I get around a dozen of those errors per day (I use MySQL 5.7), on a low traffic website that has less than a thousand visits a day. The session table has less than 1000 rows, the garbage collector is working correctly. I guess prior to `2.0.13` the errors were not exposed through the standard error logger - now this is fixed by #14908 

I'm not entirely sure why would the generated session id collide so often. My solution does the check if session id already exists in the storage in a transaction. Performance impact should be negligible as there should be only one session read/write per request.

issue.title: Database exception using DbSession

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
### What steps will reproduce the problem?
When I'm trying to login on the website, from time to time I'm receiving an error message.
After reloading of the page everything is ok.
`YII_DEBUG `is enabled, `YII_ENV_DEV` is set to true.

Maybe this issue is linked with [this one](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/pull/1812)

[Stackoverflow question](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/41158812/yii2-dbsession-exception)
### What do you get instead?

> Integrity constraint violation  yii\db\IntegrityException
> 
> SQLSTATE[23000]: Integrity constraint violation: 1062 Duplicate entry '0' for key 'PRIMARY'
> The SQL being executed was: UPDATE `session` SET `id`=0 WHERE `id`='3u5r7gq6pqh8s0gjrusfqpmni7'
> Error Info: Array
> (
>     [0] => 23000
>     [1] => 1062
>     [2] => Duplicate entry '0' for key 'PRIMARY'
> )
> 
> Caused by: PDOException
> 
> SQLSTATE[23000]: Integrity constraint violation: 1062 Duplicate entry '0' for key 'PRIMARY'
> 
> in /var/www/develop/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/Command.php at line 844

### Additional info

| Q                | A
| ---------------- | ---
| Yii version      | 2.0.10
| PHP version      | 7.0
| Operating system | Ubuntu 14.04

body: @samdark  If youre busy ATM, I would  implement the feature next week to resolve #13212.
